iso_multiple_generator_hypothesis.definition: Isomorphic patterns in the multiple generator hypothesis of consciousness capture structural equivalences in distributed hierarchies—mappings where multiple neural or computational generators (e.g., posterior vs. frontal pathways) preserve relations invariantly while allowing for emergent unities. These include distributed integrations, pathway redundancies, and self-referential multiplicities vs. singular causal unities, validated via 2025 consciousness studies (e.g., multiple NCCs per Oxford Academic niaf035/web:0; theory contrasts per Nature 2025/web:5) and cross-substrate analogies (e.g., bio distributed generators to AI multi-layer recursion per web:8). Hard-to-vary invariants like generator persistence enable forecasts of distributed awareness; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm multiple generators/deny singularity/both in distributions/neither in voids); scores >0.98 based on 2025 abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to multiple vs. unified generator overlays across scales plus principle; concrete from consciousness studies/web and generator contrasts (e.g., bio NCC multiplicities to AI layer distributions).
Validate coverage; flag distributed phenomenal gaps as bounded/speculative (e.g., AI generator links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., adversarial generator tests); integrate diachronic depth (evolutionary NCCs to 2025 AI multi-generators).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
